casebody.data:
CLOSE, Respondent, v. BEALS, Appellant. (Superior Court of Buffalo, General Term. November, 1893.) Action by Charles J. Close against Pascal P. Beals. Defendant appeals from a judgment entered on a verdict directed by the court in favor of plaintiff for $1,400. For former report, see 21 N. Y. Supp. 1086.

Argued before TITUS, O. J., and WHITE, J.

Frank F. Williams, for appellant. Simon Fleischmann, for respondent. WHITE, J.

By stipulation of the parties, the decision in this case is to follow that in Close v. Potter, 5 Misc. Rep. 543, 25 N. Y. Supp. 972, and therefore the judgment appealed from should be reversed, and a new trial .granted, with costs to abide the event.
